DataElement.preferredName: Within Bone Marrow Interval Last Systemic Therapy And Collection Neoplastic Cell Prior Hematopoietic Cell Transplantation Detection Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not tumor cells were detected in the bone marrow, in the interval between the last systemic therapy and collection prior to the hematopoietic cell transplantation .

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Within Bone Marrow Interval Last Systemic Therapy And Collection Neoplastic Cell Prior Hematopoietic Cell Transplantation Detection
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: On the inside; contained in._The soft, sponge-like tissue in the center of bones that produces white blood cells, red blood cells, and platelets._The period of time or the distance separating two instances, events, or occurrences._Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining._(sis-TEM-ik THER-a-pee) Treatment using substances that travel through the bloodstream, reaching and affecting cells all over the body._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place._Cells of, or derived from, a tumor._Earlier in time or order._Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.) ._Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species._The activity of perceiving, discerning, discovering or identifying.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Within Bone Marrow Interval Last Systemic Therapy And Collection Neoplastic Cell
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: On the inside; contained in.:The soft, sponge-like tissue in the center of bones that produces white blood cells, red blood cells, and platelets.:The period of time or the distance separating two instances, events, or occurrences.:Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining.:(sis-TEM-ik THER-a-pee) Treatment using substances that travel through the bloodstream, reaching and affecting cells all over the body.:An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:The act of gathering something together.:Cells of, or derived from, a tumor.

Concepts.definition: On the inside; contained in.
The tissue occupying the spaces of bone. It consists of blood vessel sinuses and a network of hematopoietic cells which give rise to the red cells, white cells, and megakaryocytes.
The period of time or the distance separating two instances, events, or occurrences.
Coming after all others in time or space or degree or being the only one remaining.
Treatment using substances that travel through the bloodstream, reaching and affecting cells all over the body.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
The act of gathering things together; having been brought together in one place.
Cells of, or derived from, a tumor.

Property.preferredName: Prior Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation Detection
Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.):The grafting of tissues from one individual to another or place to place within a single individual.:No value exists.

Concepts.definition: Earlier in time or order.

Primitive blood cells derived from embryonic mesenchyme capable of differentiating into any of the blood cell line progenitor cells (erythroblasts, young granulocytic series cells, megakaryocytes, etc.)
Transference of a tissue or organ within an individual, between individuals of the same species, or between individuals of different species.
The act of perceiving, discerning, discovering, or identifying.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Artificial Neural Network Algorithm for BRIDG Mapping

AlternateNames.name: Within Bone Marrow Interval Last Systemic Therapy And Collection Neoplastic Cell Prior Hematopoietic Stem Cell Transplantation Detection Indicator

ReferenceDocuments.name: Were tumor cells detected in
ReferenceDocuments.description: Were tumor cells detected in bone marrow, in the interval between last systemic therapy and collection prior to HCT?

ReferenceDocuments.name: BRIDG mapping path for CDE:2749801
ReferenceDocuments.description: "Subject [recipient] > PerformedObservation > PerformedClinicalResult.value(ANY=>BL)  WHERE PerformedObservation > DefinedObservation.nameCode = ""test for tumor cells""  AND DefinedObservation.methodCode = {specified method}  AND PerformedObservation.targetAnatomicSiteCode = ""bone marrow""  AND PerformedObservation.dateRange IS GREATER THAN {date of last systemic therapy} AND PerformedObservation.dateRange IS LESS THAN {date of collection}   {date of last systemic therapy} is determined by: Subject > PerformedProcedure.dateRange WHERE PerformedProcedure> DefinedProcedure.nameCode = {Systemic Therapy}  AND PerformedProcedure.dateRange IS MAXIMUM  {date of collection} is determined by: Subject > PerformedSubstanceExtraction.dateRange WHERE PerformedSubstanceExtraction > DefinedProcedure.nameCode = ""Hematopoietic Stem Cell Collection""  AND PerformedSubstanceExtraction.dateRange IS MAXIMUM"

DataElement.changeDescription: . 2021-2-23 ak Ok to release per WZ. System generated def displayed as alt def.
